intro: Eupatorium jujuiense, commonly known as the Indian thoroughwort, is a flowering plant native to the Indian subcontinent. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its tall, erect stem and clusters of small, white to pale blue flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded areas and is often found in forested regions. Its leaves are lance-shaped and have a rough texture, while its flowers bloom during the summer months. Eupatorium jujuiense is also known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional Ayurvedic medicine.
